To anyone reading this, please don't use "natural" cleaners. Especially with covid, it's so important to properly clean things, and vinegar and essential oils simply do not cut it. If you cleaned a mess with a "natural" cleaner and looked at it under a Petri dish, I think you'd be astounded at the insane amount of harmful bacteria. If you want things actually clean, use real cleaners. Of course, there's no need to get products that are heavily scented or perfumed, but please, please don't DIY or buy "natural" products. Also, a steam mop isn't going to do anything either. Taking one small rag / cleaning surface for the entire house is just not going to get it clean! You're just dragging the dirt around at that point. To get your place actually clean, check out GoCleanCo on instagram. (I don't work for them, but they're going viral because their methods actually work and more people need to know about them!)

I never use the self cleaning function on my oven... it doesnt work. The best is a multi spray, dish soap (Dr. Bonner's is my fav) and baking soda or Bon Ami powder cleaner. How do you clean really unsanitary things like poop? My dogs have had diarrhea accidents and I have a small baby. I love natural products but when it comes to poop, thatâ€™s just not good enough. Iâ€™ll typically use alcohol and bleach at times. Wondering if you have any other suggestions

Seriously, please do use alcohol and bleach. "Natural" cleaners don't really do much. If people who were all about "natural" everything took a look at their beauty products or messes after cleaning with their "natural" products and did a test in a Petri dish, I think they would be astounded at the amount of harmful bacteria. There's a reason why professional cleaning companies and hospitals use bleach and other powerful substances. Also, "natural" doesn't mean much. I think people who use "natural" things like vinegar, but just like you wouldn't just swallow a bunch of vinegar, you wouldn't for bleach either, and bleach is technically "natural" as well. I really wish this natural trend would go away. I definitely don't like any products that have scent or perfume added, but I don't think "natural" is the way to go if you want to get something actually clean, either.
